title: Sri Lanka creates ministry of technology and investment promotion
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has created a new ministry of Technology and Investment Promotion placing the immigration department, the Board of Investment, Colombo Port City Commission and industrial parks under it.
Sri Lanka does not have permanent secretaries and both ministries and secretaries are fluid.
Ministries are created and destroyed by gazette notice at a dizzying pace.
Under Sri Lanka’s constitution, the ‘impermanent secretaries’ lose office as soon as the Prime Minister resigns and the cabinet is dissolved.
After ex-Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa resigned, the portfolios reverted to the President.
A Ministry of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment was also created.
Following agencies are under the Minister of Technology and Investment Promotion.
